resources.string: I\'m Denley (That\'s me to the right). I was born, raised, and educated in Adelaide, Australia. I want to lead the Android charge at Basecamp™.

I\'m into technology and gadgets (I\'m really into gadgets). I enjoy looking at new technology projects on Kickstarter™, and reading about the CES every year. I also like reading anything scientific or technical.

In my spare time I like watching sci-fi, and working on my own Android™ app ideas (including apps for my Android Wear smartwatch). I play pool (billiards) in a team with friends.

I\'m a professional Android guru (freelance Android developer). I work with clients all over the world to:
1) Build app ideas from scratch
2) Update existing apps (fixing bugs and updating designs)
3) Port existing iOS apps over to Android (while trying hard to convince them to adapt their designs)

I really enjoy what I do. I like the cutting-edge and open nature of the Android community. I like the variety of projects that keep me challenged and engaged. I like the freedom to work remotely and manage my own time. But most of all, I like that every single day I am pushed to learn new skills, improve existing ones, and keep up to date with the latest in the Android platform.

First and foremost, I want to continue to work with the Android platform, whether continuing as a freelancer, or as an employee working on Android projects.


I would like to work on products that I would find useful myself, and to work thoroughly rather than quickly, so that I can be proud of my results.


I want to surround myself with talented people whom I can respect and commend, who will push me to be my best and refine my skills, and who aren't too polite to let me know how I can improve.
